title: 2 dead, 2 injured in NE Albuquerque shooting
content:
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M —
Albuquerque police are investigating what they say is a double homicide.
Police said four people were shot inside a home in the 300 block of General Marshall Monday night. Two of them died.
The shooting happened in a neighborhood off Copper Avenue and Wyoming Boulevard. Neighbors said they hear a lot of gunfire in that area, but were pretty spooked when they learned of the double homicide early Tuesday morning.
"It's too close to home, you know? it's pretty bad," Eddie Romero said.
APD says right now they don't know if the victims were related, but say all four were found inside the home.
APD says prior to the shooting, its officers had been to the house a lot.
"Our graveyard guys and our Southeast guys and the Southeast area command have been out to the house before for numerous calls," APD spokesman Simon Drobik said.
Police have not yet released the names of the victims.
